item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 11, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: NotesHub: cross-platform, Markdown-based note-taking app (56 points | 39 comments)
2. Show HN: Pocache, preemptive optimistic caching for Go (38 points | 1 comment)
3. A Lisp compiler to RISC-V written in Lisp (122 points | 17 comments)
4. Initial CUDA Performance Lessons (58 points | 9 comments)
5. Manifest v2 is now removed from Chrome canary (89 points | 69 comments)
6. DeskPad – A virtual monitor for screen sharing (966 points | 142 comments)
7. Nurdle Patrol (89 points | 26 comments)
8. The Copenhagen Book: general guideline on implementing auth in web applications (625 points | 153 comments)
9. Join-Accumulate Machine: A Semi-Coherent Scalable Trustless VM (12 points | discuss)
10. AAA Gaming on Asahi Linux (792 points | 269 comments)
11. Scuda – Virtual GPU over IP (133 points | 24 comments)
12. Show HN: HTML for People (506 points | 167 comments)
13. AP5 - Declarative Programming Library For Common Lisp (1995) (35 points | 2 comments)
14. Apple's naming conventions are a mess (6 points | 6 comments)
15. Uxn (367 points | 67 comments)
16. Understanding the Limitations of Mathematical Reasoning in Large Language Models (69 points | 68 comments)
17. Archaeologists found an ancient Egyptian observatory (36 points | 19 comments)
18. A plain-text way to get your point across quickly and artfully in the browser (9 points | 5 comments)
19. Game Programming in Prolog (235 points | 51 comments)
20. “Lucky” Fish Could Save Lives (2015) (7 points | discuss)
21. Show HN: Tenno – Markdown and JavaScript = a hybrid of Word and Excel (354 points | 128 comments)
22. ARIA: An Open Multimodal Native Mixture-of-Experts Model (77 points | 17 comments)
23. Elle's Homepage (46 points | 18 comments)
24. History Of Hacking The Nintendo 3DS (2019) [pdf] (34 points | 2 comments)
25. A Language of Beautiful Impurity (63 points | 19 comments)
26. Helping wikis move away from Fandom (1022 points | 460 comments)
27. Bridge to Nowhere (124 points | 75 comments)
28. Proposal: JavaScript Structs (191 points | 283 comments)
29. Ceres: An ocean world in the asteroid belt (92 points | 38 comments)
30. The science behind on-the-wrist blood pressure tracking (138 points | 93 comments)
